actions.recommendation: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Retest your level in 3 to 4 months aiming for a level of 50 to 80ng/ml. Once it is in this range you can reduce to 1000iu daily.

Slightly increased BMI. You are already aware of this, have consulted with a dietician and making an effort to lose weight. Continue eating healthily and exercising moderately, however drastic weight loss would not be advisable either whilst on your fertility journey.

hsCRP is a measure of inflammation which is used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Your level falls into the average risk category. Ways to reduce inflammation include a mediterranean style diet, avoiding sugar and trans fats, exercise, not smoking, avoiding toxins as much as possible, maintaining an ideal body weight and stress reduction.
Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
To lower your cardiovascular risk focus on reducing your waist circumference rather than a number on the scale
